item.title: Prosecutor Makes The Case For Law Enforcement Access To Data
item.description: March 26, 2017 - NPR's Lulu Garcia-Navarro talks with San Bernardino County District Attorney Michael Ramos about his push to allow law enforcement to gain access to data on individuals' smartphones.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 26, 2017 - NPR's Lulu Garcia-Navarro talks with San Bernardino County District Attorney Michael Ramos about his push to allow law enforcement to gain access to data on individuals' smartphones. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/26/521550411/prosecutor-makes-the-case-for-law-enforcement-access-to-data

item.title: The Call-In: Answering Your Questions About Digital Privacy
item.description: March 26, 2017 - Seamus Tuohy, a consultant with the digital security firm Prudent Innovation, answers your questions about how to keep your data secure and your personal information private.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 26, 2017 - Seamus Tuohy, a consultant with the digital security firm Prudent Innovation, answers your questions about how to keep your data secure and your personal information private. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/26/521550404/the-call-in-answering-your-questions-about-digital-privacy

item.title: Companies And Users Can Do More To Stay Secure With 'Smart' Devices
item.description: March 26, 2017 - None of the top internet and telecom companies passed in the latest Ranking Digital Rights rankings in regard to individuals' privacy standards. But what can they do better and what can we do at home?
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 26, 2017 - None of the top internet and telecom companies passed in the latest Ranking Digital Rights rankings in regard to individuals' privacy standards. But what can they do better and what can we do at home? http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/03/26/521362526/companies-and-users-can-do-more-to-stay-secure-with-smart-devices

item.title: Telehealth Doctor Visits May Be Handy, But Aren't Cheaper Overall
item.description: March 26, 2017 - Many patients like the convenience of being able to quickly consult a doctor by text or phone or webcam instead of heading to an urgent care clinic. But the cost of consultations can add up.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 26, 2017 - Many patients like the convenience of being able to quickly consult a doctor by text or phone or webcam instead of heading to an urgent care clinic. But the cost of consultations can add up. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/26/519543337/telehealth-doctor-visits-may-be-handy-but-arent-cheaper-overall

item.title: Howard University's Aims To Build Silicon Valley Pipeline Of Black Software Engineers
item.description: March 25, 2017 - The historically black university in Washington, D.C., is sending computer science students to study at Google's headquarters in California, as part of an effort called Howard West.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 25, 2017 - The historically black university in Washington, D.C., is sending computer science students to study at Google's headquarters in California, as part of an effort called Howard West. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/25/521517159/howard-university-launches-effort-to-build-pipline-of-black-software-engineers-i

item.title: Police Videos Aren't Going Away. How Can We Learn From Them?
item.description: March 25, 2017 - In the era of body cameras and cellphones, the act of seeing police do their job is radically altering the public-police relationship, and changing civilian and police behavior and perceptions alike.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 25, 2017 - In the era of body cameras and cellphones, the act of seeing police do their job is radically altering the public-police relationship, and changing civilian and police behavior and perceptions alike. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/25/521102557/police-videos-arent-going-away-how-can-we-learn-from-them

item.title: Can Arianna Huffington Save Uber?
item.description: March 24, 2017 - While Uber wades through crisis after crisis, media mogul Arianna Huffington, the sole woman on its board, is emerging as chief of culture change.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 24, 2017 - While Uber wades through crisis after crisis, media mogul Arianna Huffington, the sole woman on its board, is emerging as chief of culture change. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/03/24/521319706/can-arianna-huffington-save-uber

item.title: U.S. Senate Votes To Repeal Obama-Era Internet Privacy Rules
item.description: March 23, 2017 - The rules would require Internet providers to tell consumers what data they collect and get consent before selling. Republicans said ISPs were facing stricter regulations than companies like Google.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 23, 2017 - The rules would require Internet providers to tell consumers what data they collect and get consent before selling. Republicans said ISPs were facing stricter regulations than companies like Google. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/03/23/521253258/u-s-senate-votes-to-repeal-obama-era-internet-privacy-rules

item.title: Hungry? Call Your Neighborhood Delivery Robot
item.description: March 23, 2017 - Self-driving delivery robots have popped up on the sidewalks of Washington, D.C. — and other locations have expressed interest. The bots learn about traffic patterns with every trip they take.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 23, 2017 - Self-driving delivery robots have popped up on the sidewalks of Washington, D.C. — and other locations have expressed interest. The bots learn about traffic patterns with every trip they take. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/03/23/520848983/hungry-call-your-neighborhood-delivery-robot

item.title: Social Media, Math And The Mystery Of A Mumps Outbreak
item.description: March 22, 2017 - Since August 2016, there have been nearly 3,000 cases of mumps diagnosed in Arkansas. A epidemiologist explains how her team used online data and mathematical modeling to understand the outbreak.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 22, 2017 - Since August 2016, there have been nearly 3,000 cases of mumps diagnosed in Arkansas. A epidemiologist explains how her team used online data and mathematical modeling to understand the outbreak. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/22/520842043/social-media-math-and-the-mystery-of-a-mumps-outbreak

item.title: A Smartphone Can Accurately Test Sperm Count
item.description: March 22, 2017 - Measuring the quality of those little swimmers usually requires a trip to the doctor. Researchers have come up with a smartphone accessory that would let men do that at home in less than five seconds.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 22, 2017 - Measuring the quality of those little swimmers usually requires a trip to the doctor. Researchers have come up with a smartphone accessory that would let men do that at home in less than five seconds. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/22/520837557/a-smartphone-can-accurately-test-sperm-count

item.title: Researchers Test Hotter, Faster And Cleaner Way To Fight Oil Spills
item.description: March 21, 2017 - The Flame Refluxer is essentially a big copper blanket: think Brillo pad of wool sandwiched between mesh. Using it while burning off oil yields less air pollution and residue that harms marine life.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 21, 2017 - The Flame Refluxer is essentially a big copper blanket: think Brillo pad of wool sandwiched between mesh. Using it while burning off oil yields less air pollution and residue that harms marine life. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/21/520861834/researchers-test-hotter-faster-and-cleaner-way-to-fight-oil-spills

item.title: New Device Restrictions On Some Flights: Few Facts, Many Questions
item.description: March 21, 2017 - Homeland Security says most personal electronics won't be allowed in carry-ons on flights from some majority-Muslim countries. The U.K. has acted similarly. Why the abrupt change? It's far from clear.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 21, 2017 - Homeland Security says most personal electronics won't be allowed in carry-ons on flights from some majority-Muslim countries. The U.K. has acted similarly. Why the abrupt change? It's far from clear. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/03/21/520958051/new-device-restrictions-on-some-flights-few-facts-many-questions

item.title: Google Vows To Remove Ads From Offensive YouTube Content
item.description: March 21, 2017 - Google says it is giving advertisers more control over where and how their ads appear. Some major advertisers in the U.K. were outraged and some pared back their spending after their ads appeared on YouTube videos created by backers of ISIS and a violent pro-fascist group. Google also says it's removing more ads from extremist content and hiring more people to deal with the problem.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 21, 2017 - Google says it is giving advertisers more control over where and how their ads appear. Some major advertisers in the U.K. were outraged and some pared back their spending after their ads appeared on YouTube videos created by backers of ISIS and a violent pro-fascist group. Google also says it's removing more ads from extremist content and hiring more people to deal with the problem. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/21/520996091/google-vows-to-remove-ads-from-offensive-youtube-content

item.title: Google Promises To Keep Ads Off 'Hateful, Offensive' YouTube Content
item.description: March 21, 2017 - On Friday, a division of a global marketing group with a digital budget of more than $200 million put its dealings with Google on "pause," citing recent controversies.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
